summary: In 2017, 4 disasters—hurricanes Harvey, Irma, Maria, and the California wildfires—created unprecedented demand for federal disaster help. The federal government has provided at least $120 billion in supplemental funding for these disasters, as well as help with response and recovery. For example, FEMA provided significant support to Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands in response to Hurricanes Irma and Maria. However, we found that...
title: 2017 Hurricanes and Wildfires: Initial Observations on the Federal Response and Key Recovery Challenges
